name: grain
yarn_weight: any gauge - designed for any gauge
sizes_available: finished shawl measures 63" across and 23" deep
notes:
--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------

**grain** - by tin can knits
============

--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------

**the grain shawl pattern is now available in the free tin can knits app!** 

[click here to download the app, or to learn more.][1]

• only see the size instructions you need
• tick through the pattern and make notes
• support is just a tap away
• adjust the settings to suit you!

*learn to knit with alexa and emily! the grain shawl is part of [the simple collection][2] - a learn to knit series with excellent free patterns and clear tutorials.
from your first scarf, to mittens, socks, and sweaters, learn all you need to know to make modern seamless knits for all of your loved ones.*

--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------

**like our knits?**  [get our email updates][3] to hear about new designs, tutorials and subscriber-only special offers!

--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------


**pattern info**

**sizing**  
finished shawl measures approximately 63“ across and 23“ deep

**yarn**   
600 yards worsted / aran weight yarn
700 yards dk weight yarn
800 yards sock / fingering weight yarn

*(sample was shown in sweet fiber cashmere aran, 1 skein of ‘moonstone’, 1 skein of ‘chartreuse’, 2 skeins each of ‘smoke’ and ‘olive’)*

**needles**  
worsted: us #9 / 5.5mm 32” circular needle
dk: us #7 / 4.5mm 32” circular needle
fingering: us #4 / 3.5mm 32” circular needle
*(or as required to meet gauge)*

**gauge**  
in worsted (dk, fingering): 14 (20, 24) sts and 36 (40, 52) rows / 4” in garter stitch

**notions** 
stitch markers, darning needle

**helpful tutorials**
[let's knit a simple shawl][4]
[how to work a garter tab cast on][5]

---------------------------------------------

for all pattern abbreviations, techniques, and to contact us, visit [www.tincanknits.com][6]
